meanings.definition: Ashlar masonry consisting of thin slabs of stone.
meanings.sent1: The ancient castle was built with sturdy ashlaring that has stood the test of time.
meanings.sent2: The skilled masons carefully placed each piece of ashlaring to create a beautiful facade.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tried to climb the smooth ashlaring walls but kept slipping down.
meanings.sent4: The ashlaring gleamed in the sunlight, giving the building an elegant appearance.
meanings.sent5: The ashlaring, like a puzzle, fit together perfectly to form a strong structure.

meanings.sent1: The builders will ashlaring the new cathedral using the finest stones available.
meanings.sent2: They plan to ashlaring the entire courtyard to give it a more polished look.
meanings.sent3: The workers joked that they could ashlaring a house in a day if they worked together.
meanings.sent4: She watched in amazement as they began to ashlaring the walls with precision and skill.
meanings.sent5: The team's goal was to ashlaring the structure quickly without compromising quality.

meanings.definition: The act of using ashlar masonry in construction.
meanings.sent1: The architect's design called for the careful ashlaring of the entire building.
meanings.sent2: His expertise in ashlaring ensured that the project would be completed on time.
meanings.sent3: The competition challenged participants to showcase their skills in ashlaring.
meanings.sent4: The ashlaring of the walls added a touch of elegance to the modern structure.
meanings.sent5: The ashlaring process required patience and attention to detail to achieve perfection.
